subtitleNullable: Urban classification by structures, roads, and nature
descriptionNullable:
Dataset of ~1800 Aerial Photographs of an Urban area classified into 5 categories, depending on which was most prevalent in the image:
- Residential housing / neighborhoods
- Commercial / industrial / public buildings
- Nature: Parks, trees, river, empty land
- Roads / Highways
- Undecided (In the case of two or more categories being very visible)

Source: Images were taken from a dataset found at [https://data.kitware.com/#collection/58bd8c5b8d777f0aef5d150f/folder/58bdd1958d777f0aef5d1513](url)

Original images are of resolution 6600x4400, some images were taken and divided into "tiles" of 400x400. Each tile was then labeled with the most relevant category in Label Studio. Not all of the original ~3000 images were taken and not all tiles were taken to save time and because many are redundant, having only very small differences.

Update Frequency: Likely never, as the original photographs are not diverse enough to warrant further tagging in my opinion. If I do more classification datasets in the future they will be placed in different projects.

Note: The data in this set is likely not diverse enough for a general classification of urban areas, and should probably be merged with other datasets of the same category for better results.

License: The original photos have been published on the site as Public, and with no further information. Upon a bit of digging it seems the company they came from originally is Transparent Sky LLC but with no link on their own website and it being a very old HTML website, there is no way to tell for certain.
title: Aerial Drone Urban Classification
subtitle: Urban classification by structures, roads, and nature

Original images are of resolution 6600x4400, some images were taken and divided into "tiles" of 400x400. Each tile was then labeled with the most relevant category in Label Studio.
